intro: Alstonia lenormandii var. lenormandii, commonly known as the Madagascar flame tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, fiery red flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Native to Madagascar, it thrives in tropical climates with well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in warm regions.
